Class SimpleChart

java.lang.Object
com.arbergashi.charts.SimpleChart
public class SimpleChart extends Object
Simplified chart API with fluent interface.

Design Philosophy: Developer should be able to create production-ready charts in 2-5 lines of code.

Feature Highlights

  • Fluent API: Method chaining for readability
  • Sensible Defaults: Works without configuration
  • Type-Safe: Compile-time validation
  • Zero-GC: Inherited from core framework

Quick Examples

Minimal Line Chart

Charts.lineChart()
    .addData(1, 10, 2, 20, 3, 15)
    .show();

Styled Chart

Charts.lineChart()
    .title("Sales 2026")
    .subtitle("Q1 Performance")
    .xLabel("Month")
    .yLabel("Revenue (CHF)")
    .theme("obsidian")
    .addData(1, 100, 2, 150, 3, 200)
    .show();

Real-Time Streaming

Charts.streamingLineChart(1000)
    .title("CPU Usage")
    .updateInterval(100)
    .startStreaming(() -> getCpuUsage())
    .show();

Export to PNG

Charts.lineChart()
    .addData(data)
    .exportToPNG("chart.png");
Since:
2.0.0

    • theme

      public SimpleChart theme(String theme)
      Sets the visual theme.

      Available themes:

      • dark - Dark background (default)
      • light - Light background
      • obsidian - Professional dark theme
      Parameters:
      theme - the theme name
      Returns:
      this chart for chaining

    • addData

      public SimpleChart addData(double... values)
      Adds data points to the chart.

      Accepts alternating x,y values for convenience: 

      chart.addData(1, 10, 2, 20, 3, 30);
// Equivalent to:
chart.addPoint(1, 10);
chart.addPoint(2, 20);
chart.addPoint(3, 30);
      Parameters:
      values - alternating x,y values
      Returns:
      this chart for chaining
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if odd number of values

    • addPoint

      public SimpleChart addPoint(double x, double y)
      Adds a single data point.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y value
      Returns:
      this chart for chaining

    • enableStreaming

      public SimpleChart enableStreaming()
      Enables real-time streaming mode.
      Returns:
      this chart for chaining

    • updateInterval

      public SimpleChart updateInterval(int intervalMs)
      Sets the streaming update interval in milliseconds.
      Parameters:
      intervalMs - update interval (default: 100ms = 10 Hz)
      Returns:
      this chart for chaining

    • startStreaming

      public SimpleChart startStreaming(Supplier<Double> dataSource)
      Starts streaming data from a supplier.

      Example

      chart.startStreaming(() -> sensor.readTemperature());
      Parameters:
      dataSource - supplier that provides new Y values
      Returns:
      this chart for chaining
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - streaming not yet implemented

    • show

      public SimpleChart show()
      Displays the chart in a window.

      Requires arbercharts-swing-bridge on classpath. Uses ServiceLoader to find the appropriate chart display implementation.

      Returns:
      this chart for chaining
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if swing-bridge is not on classpath

    • exportToPNG

      public SimpleChart exportToPNG(String filename)
      Exports the chart to PNG file.
      Parameters:
      filename - the output filename
      Returns:
      this chart for chaining
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - export not yet implemented
